channel.title: Networking? Help pl0x
channel.description:
wassup.
Im having trouble with networking, I just cant get it to work.
I make a ServerSocket then use accept() to make a new socket. That part works. But how do you read from it and then transfer it to System.out?
All help appreciated. ( also help on writing to it :P thank you)

thanks for all you’re help guys, its appreciated

Yes, the boolean parameter for the PrintWriter constructor is the automatic flush.

item.title: Networking? Help pl0x
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

My bad, psuedocode ftw
Scanner.nextLine();
and when you make the printwriter:

PrintWriter p = new PrintWriter(sock.getOutputStream(), true);

That should make it automatically flush…but don’t quote me on that

Ohh…and PrintWriter has a println method =]

Read full topic

@White_Castle wrote:

You have to call flush() on the PrintWriter.

item.title: Networking? Help pl0x
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

omg thanks iamadam! <3

EDIT:… somethign not working. btw, a scanner does not have a readLine method.

could you point me in the right direction?

[code]import java.io.PrintWriter;
import java.net.InetAddress;
import java.net.ServerSocket;
import java.net.Socket;
import java.util.Scanner;

public class all
{
public static void main(String args[])
{
Server s = new Server();
new Thread(s).start();

	Client c = new Client();
	
	c.append("hello world");
	c.append("world");
}

}

class Server implements Runnable
{
Scanner in;
public Server()
{
try{

		ServerSocket s = new ServerSocket(4000);
		Socket client = s.accept();
		in = new Scanner(client.getInputStream()); 
	
	}catch(Exception e){e.printStackTrace();}
	
}

public void run()
{
	while(true) 
	{
		//while(in.hasNext())
			System.out.println(in.nextLine());
	}
}

}

class Client
{
PrintWriter p;
public Client()
{
try{
InetAddress host = InetAddress.getLocalHost();
int port = 4000;
Socket sock = new Socket(host, port);
p = new PrintWriter(sock.getOutputStream());

		append("test");
		
	}catch(Exception e){e.printStackTrace();}
}
public void append(String t)
{
	p.append(t);
}

}
[/code]

It just stands there doing nothing.

Read full topic

item.title: Networking? Help pl0x
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

After you have made the Socket, you can set up and input/output stream on it. If you’re writing text, to receive you’d do something like…

ServerSocket s = new ServerSocket(1337);
  Socket client = s.accept();
  Scanner in = new Scanner(client.getInputStream()); //You don't have to use scanner if ya don't want, some people don't like it.

  while(true) {
    System.out.println(in.readLine());
  }

Obviously that’s gonna need some try/catching.

Ok, the client part is done basically like this:

InetAddress host = InetAddress.getLocalHost();
int port = 1337;
Socket sock = new Socket(host, port);
PrintWriter p = new PrintWriter(sock.getOutputStream());
//Write whatever...

Read full topic
